name: Algorithm
description: A step-by-step procedure for solving a problem or performing a task.

name: Array
description: A data structure that stores a collection of elements, typically of the same type, in a contiguous memory location.

name: Variable
description: A named storage location in memory used to store data that can change during the program's execution.

name: Function
description: A self-contained block of code that can be called to perform a specific task or computation.

name: Loop
description: A control structure that repeatedly executes a block of code as long as a specified condition is true.

name: Object
description: A composite data type that groups related data and functions into a single entity.

name: Class
description: A blueprint or template for creating objects, defining their attributes and behaviors.

name: Inheritance
description: A mechanism in object-oriented programming where a class inherits properties and methods from another class.

name: Polymorphism
description: The ability of different objects to respond to the same method in a way that is specific to their individual types.

name: Encapsulation
description: The bundling of data and methods that operate on that data into a single unit known as an object.

name: Recursion
description: A technique in which a function calls itself to solve a problem by breaking it down into smaller, similar sub-problems.

name: Database
description: A structured collection of data organized and stored for easy access, retrieval, and management.

name: Debugging
description: The process of identifying and fixing errors and defects in software code.

name: Server
description: A computer or software that provides services or resources to other computers, known as clients, over a network.

name: Frontend
description: The user interface of a software application or website that users interact with directly.

name: Backend
description: The server-side of a software application responsible for processing data and performing computations.

name: Databases
description: Systems for storing, managing, and retrieving structured data, including relational databases and NoSQL databases.

name: Authentication
description: The process of verifying the identity of a user or system before granting access to protected resources.

name: Authorization
description: The process of determining what actions or resources a user or system is allowed to access after authentication.

name: JSON (JavaScript Object Notation)
description: A lightweight data interchange format that is easy for humans to read and write and easy for machines to parse and generate.

name: XML (eXtensible Markup Language)
description: A markup language that defines rules for encoding documents in a format that is both human-readable and machine-readable.

name: REST (Representational State Transfer)
description: An architectural style for designing networked applications, emphasizing simplicity and scalability.

name: HTTP Methods
description: HTTP verbs used to indicate the desired action to be performed on a resource, such as GET, POST, PUT, and DELETE.

name: URL (Uniform Resource Locator)
description: A reference or address used to access resources on the internet, specifying the protocol, domain, and path.

name: Responsive Web Design
description: Designing web pages that adapt and provide an optimal viewing experience on various devices and screen sizes.

name: CMS (Content Management System)
description: Software used to create, manage, and organize digital content, typically for websites.

name: Unit Testing
description: A software testing technique where individual units or components of a program are tested in isolation.

name: Integration Testing
description: Testing the interactions between different modules, components, or services to ensure they work together as one

name: Conditional Statement
description: A programming construct that allows you to make decisions and execute different code blocks based on a condition.

name: Data Type
description: A classification that specifies which type of data can be stored in a variable, such as integers, strings, and floating-point numbers.

name: Exception Handling
description: A mechanism for dealing with runtime errors or exceptional conditions in a program to prevent it from crashing.

name: API (Application Programming Interface)
description: A set of rules and protocols that allows different software applications to communicate and interact with each other.

name: Version Control
description: A system that tracks and manages changes to source code and other files, enabling collaboration and code history tracking.

name: IDE (Integrated Development Environment)
description: A software application that provides comprehensive tools for writing, testing, and debugging code.

name: Regular Expression
description: A pattern-matching language used for searching and manipulating strings based on specified patterns.

name: Web Development
description: The process of creating websites and web applications using technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

name: HTTP (Hypertext Transfer Protocol)
description: A protocol used for transferring data over the World Wide Web, typically used for requesting and serving web pages.

name: SQL (Structured Query Language)
description: A domain-specific language used for managing and querying relational databases.

name: Web Server
description: A software or hardware system that serves web content to client devices over the internet.

name: Web Hosting
description: The service of providing server space and resources for hosting websites and web applications.

name: Version Control System (VCS)
description: Software tools that track and manage changes to source code and files, enabling collaboration and code history tracking.

name: API Endpoint
description: A specific URL or URI that represents a point of interaction for a web-based API.
